DRM101Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM101Y1-Y-20219.courseTitle: Introduction to Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM101Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription: The course introduces students to key concepts and issues in the three related disciplines at the core of our program: drama, theatre, and performance studies. We consider broader questions of performance and performativity in daily life alongside the questions of what goes into the making of a stage-based performance and the responsibilities of artists, presenters, and witnesses in this endeavour. Engaging critically with theoretical and dramatic texts and live performances, students learn how to think about performance in its cultural, social, aesthetic and political dimensions, and how to acknowledge and navigate their own responsibilities as culture workers situated in specific historical and contemporary contexts. This course combines weekly two-hour lectures with one-hour tutorials.
DRM101Y1-Y-20219.exclusion: DRM100Y1, DRE121H5, DRE122H5, VPDA10H3, VPDA11H3, VPDA10H3, VPDA15H3, VPDB10H3, VPDB11H3
DRM101Y1-Y-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Students must sign up for either one online tutorial (Tuesday 11am-12pm EST) or one in-person tutorial (Tuesday 12pm-1pm EST).
DRM101Y1-Y-20219.deliveryInstructions: This is an online synchronous online course. Students will be required to participate in synchronous online classes (Tuesday 9am -11am EST). Students must sign up for either one online tutorial (Tuesday 11am-12pm EST) or one in-person tutorial (Tuesday 12pm-1pm EST). Students need a webcam and microphone (can be built-in) and the ability to use Blackboard Collaborate and Zoom.
DRM101Y1-Y-20219.breadthCategories: Creative and Cultural Representations (1), Society and its Institutions (3)

enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

DRM200Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM200Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription: Emphasis is initially placed on ensemble, non-verbal, and improvisational work. Students proceed to the application of their acquired skills to scripted material. Students may apply in their first or second year of University. The Application Deadline is March 10th for the first round of auditions; August 10th for the second round. Please consult the CDTPS undergraduate web page for information on how to apply.
DRM200Y1-Y-20219.prerequisite: An audition and interview in April or in August. Newly admitted students can apply for an audition before beginning their first year of studies.
DRM200Y1-Y-20219.exclusion: DRS221H5 AND DRS222H5; VPDB01H3 AND VPDB02H3
DRM200Y1-Y-20219.webTimetableInstructions: There are two rounds of auditions and interviews: March 10th and August 10th. See DRM200Y Audition Guidelines

DRM202H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM202H1-F-20219.courseDescription: A practical introduction to directing theatre and to the different styles, concerns, and goals that can guide directors in their relations to actors, audiences, and politics. Through lectures, discussions, and practical exercises, students learn how directors prepare for their work in terms of generating ideas, breaking down a text, animating space, and communicating with actors and audiences.
DRM202H1-F-20219.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; DRM101Y1

DRM220Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM220Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription: This course will introduce students to major developments in world theatre history through the exploration of a wide range of plays, performances, and practices. In the Fall term our trajectory will go roughly from antiquity to the 16th Century; in the Winter term, from the 16th Century to the present. We will examine material from Africa, America, Asia, Europe, and Oceania, with close attention to the social, religious, historical, aesthetic, and political parameters in which theatre and performance take place. Nurturing ethnically sensitive approaches to world theatre history, this course considers the many ways theatre and performance interact with the globalized world. Students will have an opportunity to participate in collaborative projects and focus on writing for research in the performing arts.
DRM220Y1-Y-20219.breadthCategories: Creative and Cultural Representations (1), Thought, Belief and Behaviour (2)

DRM224H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM224H1-F-20219.courseDescription: Across centuries and global traditions, theatre has staged imaginations - and real demonstrations - of mechanical humans and other animals. This course introduces students to a wide range of technological performers, from science-fiction drama to drone ballets, from baroque automata to virtual puppeteering. Special attention will be paid to how these figures both construct and dismantle concepts of race, gender, and the human. Hands-on sessions will introduce students to the problems such performers present in the studio.

DRM228H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM228H1-S-20219.courseDescription: A hands-on study of the craft of dramatic writing. The class examines the basic elements of playwriting such as plot, structure, theme, character, dialogue, setting, with an emphasis on story-making. Attention is given to the development of students own work through written assignments and in-class exercises.
DRM228H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; DRM101Y1

DRM254H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM254H1-F-20219.courseDescription: A practical and theoretical introduction to the fundamentals of theatrical performance design. This course touches on theatre architecture, conceptual approaches to theatrical design and spatial considerations of live performance. Students will work on case studies and practical projects geared toward understanding theatre terminology, design, and production processes. Students will also explore concrete aspects of technical theatre production, particularly as they pertain to theatrical design elements.

DRM300Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM300Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription: Building upon the work of DRM200Y1, students concentrate on scene study, styles of acting, and the development of ensemble work with an intensive focus on voice and movement practices. The Application Deadline is March 10th.
DRM300Y1-Y-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1 and DRM200Y1
DRM300Y1-Y-20219.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A if DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1 is complete
DRM300Y1-Y-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM302H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM302H1-S-20219.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM202H1, concentrating on deepening the exploration of what it means to think and work like a director. Through practical exercises and scene study, students learn how to conceptualize a production and how to communicate their vision, as well as deepen their understanding of what is involved in directing actors and collaborating with a production team. Please consult the CDTPS undergraduate web page for information on how to apply and the deadline to apply.
DRM302H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1; DRM202H1; and an interview in November.
DRM302H1-S-20219.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A.
DRM302H1-S-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Students need to apply online by November 10, 2021. See Application Guidelines

DRM320H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM320H1-F-20219.courseTitle: Concepts of Theatre in the Twentieth and Twenty-first Centuries
DRM320H1-F-20219.courseDescription: An exploration of the shifting landscapes of European theatre theory, history and practice in the late 19th century and their repercussions throughout the 20th and 21st centuries. The course focuses on the developments of modern and post-dramatic theatre. It also includes critical analysis of the annual Drama Mainstage production and current Canadian theatre.

enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

DRM328H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM328H1-F-20219.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM228H1, concentrating on the in-depth knowledge and practice of playwriting with an emphasis on style and technique of writing for the stage. Students develop their own work through written assignments, in-class exercises, and the final public presentation. Please consult the CDTPS undergraduate web page for information on how to apply and the deadline to apply.
DRM328H1-F-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1; DRM228H1; and  a portfolio of writing samples due in April.
DRM328H1-F-20219.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A
DRM328H1-F-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM331H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM331H1-F-20219.courseDescription: Study of dramaturgical theory and of interpretations of the dramaturge's function in the theatre. Using examples from Canada and beyond, students apply this knowledge to theatre practice.

DRM354H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM354H1-S-20219.courseDescription: An intermediate-level investigation of various aspects of theatrical performance design, with a focus on scenic and costume design, though also considering the impact of projections and lighting. Using skills developed through practical study in the Design Studio, the students form the core of the design team for Drama productions. Applications are required in order to enroll in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for specific procedures and deadlines.
DRM354H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1; DRM254H1; and an interview.
DRM354H1-S-20219.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A
DRM354H1-S-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Students need to apply online by November 10, 2021. See Application Guidelines

DRM355Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM355Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription: An intermediate-level investigation of various aspects of theatrical production, including stage management, lighting, sound and video, with some exploration of how these elements relate to theatrical design concepts. Using skills developed through practical study in the Helen Gardiner Phelan Playhouse, the students form the core of the production team for Drama productions. Applications are required in order to enroll in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Guidelines for specific procedures and deadlines.
DRM355Y1-Y-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1; DRM254H1; and an interview.
DRM355Y1-Y-20219.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A
DRM355Y1-Y-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM363H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM363H1-S-20219.courseTitle: Story-ing the Possible: Talking Treaties, Rehearsing (Re) conciliation
DRM363H1-S-20219.courseDescription: This half course offers a comprehensive examination of Indigenous history in the territories (now called Canada); Treaty Relationships, and Indigenous-Settler Relationships, as they have shifted and evolved since first contact. Students will enter into conversation with this history and the contemporary issues confronting all Canadians today through the writings of Indigenous playwrights, oral history keepers, academic historians, and Indigenous theorists.

LEC-5101.meetingStatusNotes: November 11, 2021: delivery method changed to ONLSYNC

DRM375H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM375H1-F-20219.courseDescription: An in-depth examination of selected performance disciplines, styles, and genres within their historical and critical context. Content may vary depending on instructor. Please check Studio Topics on the CDTPS undergraduate web page for more details.
DRM375H1-F-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses:  DRM101Y1; DRM200Y1/DRM202H1/DRM228H1/DRM254H1

DRM376H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM376H1-S-20219.courseDescription: An in-depth examination of selected performance disciplines, styles, and genres within their historical and critical context. Content may vary depending on instructor. Please check Studio Topics on the CDTPS undergraduate web page for more details.
DRM376H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1; DRM200Y1/DRM202H1/DRM228H1/DRM254H1

DRM378H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM378H1-S-20219.courseDescription: An in-depth examination of selected performance disciplines, styles, and genres within their historical and critical context. Content may vary depending on instructor. Please check Studio Topics on the CDTPS undergraduate web page for more details.
DRM378H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses:  DRM101Y1; DRM200Y1/DRM202H1/DRM228H1/DRM254H1

DRM385H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM385H1-S-20219.courseTitle: Special Topics in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM385H1-S-20219.courseDescription: An in-depth examination of selected issues in drama, theatre and performance studies. Special Topics vary for Breadth distribution depending on the course content. Please consult the Undergraduate Drama office and check Special Topics on the website for more details.

LEC-5101.subtitle: Radical Performance Art: Local, Global, and Digital

DRM391H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM391H1-F-20219.courseTitle: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM391H1-F-20219.courseDescription:
"

An independent research project at the 300 level proposed by the student in conversation with a full-time faculty member who agrees to act as their supervisor for the course. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details

"
DRM391H1-F-20219.prerequisite: 10.0 credits; Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum 3.0 CGPA; Independent Study Application Form and description of project/syllabus signed by the student and the faculty supervisor; approval of the Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies (CDTPS). Application deadlines: August 1st for September start date; November 1st for January start date.
DRM391H1-F-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Third and fourth year Drama Major or Specialist students may apply for an independent study by following the CDTPS Independent Study Policy.

DRM391H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM391H1-S-20219.courseTitle: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM391H1-S-20219.courseDescription:
"

An independent research project at the 300 level proposed by the student in conversation with a full-time faculty member who agrees to act as their supervisor for the course. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details

"
DRM391H1-S-20219.prerequisite: 10.0 credits; Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum 3.0 CGPA; Independent Study Application Form and description of project/syllabus signed by the student and the faculty supervisor; approval of the Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies (CDTPS). Application deadlines: August 1st for September start date; November 1st for January start date.
DRM391H1-S-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Third and fourth year Drama Major or Specialist students may apply for an independent study by following the CDTPS Independent Study Policy.

DRM400H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM400H1-F-20219.courseDescription: Advanced Performance builds on the training sequence of DRM200Y1 and DRM300Y1 by developing students’ acting and performance skills in monologues, extensive collaborative scene work, and preparations for auditions. The work focuses on the particulars of character development and the emotional and technical aspects of the actor’s craft. Applications are required in order to enroll in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for specific procedures and deadlines.
DRM400H1-F-20219.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1
DRM400H1-F-20219.corequisite: DRM403Y1 or permission of the Centre
DRM400H1-F-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM402H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM402H1-F-20219.courseDescription: An exploration of advanced directing for the theatre. The class is centered on student directed productions, which are publicly presented at the end of term. Emphasis is placed on the development of strong central concepts and realizing the production with imagination, collaboration and creativity. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for specific procedures and deadlines.
DRM402H1-F-20219.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM302H1; DRM331H1; a written proposal and an interview in April.
DRM402H1-F-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM403Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM403Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription: This course, taught each year by a different visiting professional theatre director, offers upper-level theatre and performance studies students the opportunity to explore acting in a full-length production. Plays are selected to challenge students in a variety of diverse ways, exposing them to a full spectrum of theatre and performance genres and possibilities. Applications are required in order to enroll in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for specific procedures and deadlines.
DRM403Y1-Y-20219.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1; DRM300Y1, 0.5 credit from DRM368H1/DRM375H1/DRM376H1/DRM377H1/DRM378H1.
DRM403Y1-Y-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM413H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM413H1-S-20219.courseDescription: Voice and Movement is a skill-developing companion to the DRM400H1 training for performers. It exposes students to a wide range of voice and movement techniques and explores a heightened use of physicality, voice and speech.
DRM413H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1/ DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1
DRM413H1-S-20219.corequisite: DRM403Y1 or permission of the Centre
DRM413H1-S-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Deadline to apply is March 10th. See Application Guidelines

DRM424H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM424H1-F-20219.courseDescription: This course introduces students to independent research-creation in the field of contemporary digital performance. Readings and invited guests will expose students to innovative practices in theatres and online platforms, and outline current political and academic debates around liveness, copyright, and social media. Students will pursue research on a contemporary artist who is integrating the performing arts with computational media, and create a performance piece responding to issues raised by their research.

DRM428H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM428H1-S-20219.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM328H1, concentrating upon the in-depth knowledge and practice of playwriting with an emphasis on advanced style and technique of writing for the stage. Students develop their own longer work through in-class exercises, one major written assignment, and the final public presentation. Please consult the CDTPS undergraduate web page for information on how to apply.
DRM428H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1, DRM328H1 and a portfolio of writing samples due in November.
DRM428H1-S-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Students need to apply online by November 10, 2021. See Application Guidelines

DRM431H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM431H1-S-20219.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM331H1 Dramaturgy. Students will be provided with finer conceptual tools with which to approach DRM402H1 Advanced Directing and DRM403Y1 Mainstage Performance.

DRM462H1-F-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM462H1-F-20219.courseTitle: Black Playwrights: Resistance, Resilience and Transformation
DRM462H1-F-20219.courseDescription: An exploration of dramatic literature by writers from the African Diaspora (Canada, USA, UK and the Caribbean) from 1959 to the present. The course will identify playwrights central to the development of Black theatre, their plays, and performance practices. Emphasis will be placed on dramaturgical analysis, sociohistorical context, the author’s influences, and relevant critical writing, in order to evaluate these works as sites of social resistance, cultural resilience, and aesthetic transformation. Selected authors include: Lorraine Hansberry, Wole Soyinka, August Wilson, Derek Walcott, Debbie Hunter Green, George Elliott Clarke, Tarell Alvin McCraney, Walter Borden, Suzan-Lori Parks, Kwame Kwei-Armah and Ntozake Shange.
DRM462H1-F-20219.exclusion: DRM488H1 (Senior Seminar in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies: Black Playwrights); offered in Fall 2019

DRM487H1-S-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM487H1-S-20219.courseTitle: Senior Seminar in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM487H1-S-20219.courseDescription: An in-depth examination of selected issues in the theatre at the 400 level. Special Topics vary for Breadth distribution depending on the course content and therefore may be counted towards Groups A or B. Please consult the Undergraduate Drama office or check the program’s website for more details.
DRM487H1-S-20219.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; 14 FCE; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1.

DRM490Y1-Y-20219.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM490Y1-Y-20219.courseTitle: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM490Y1-Y-20219.courseDescription:
"

An independent research project at the 400 level proposed by the student in conversation with a full-time faculty member who agrees to act as their supervisor for the course. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details.

"
DRM490Y1-Y-20219.prerequisite: 14.0 credits; Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum 3.0 CGPA; Independent Study Application Form and description of project/syllabus signed by the student and the faculty supervisor; approval of the Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies (CDTPS). Application deadlines: August 1st for September start date; November 1st for January start date.
DRM490Y1-Y-20219.webTimetableInstructions: Fourth year Drama Major or Specialist students may apply for an independent study by following the CDTPS Independent Study Policy.
